data.title: BENGAL GOVERNOR NAMED.; Sir John Anderson Gets Post
data.text:
BENGAL GOVERNOR NAMED.; Sir John Anderson Gets Post--Was in Ireland During Worst Trouble.

BENGAL GOVERNOR NAMED.; Sir John Anderson Gets Post--Was in Ireland During Worst Trouble.

Nov. 24, 1931

See the article in its original context from

November 24, 1931 , Page 8Buy Reprints

TimesMachine is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers.

Full text is unavailable for this digitized archive article. Subscribers may view the full text of this article in its original form through TimesMachine.

LONDON, Nov. 23.--Sir John Anderson, Permanent Under-Secretary in the Home Office, who had eighteen months' experience in the republican trouble in Ireland during 1920 and 1921, has been appointed Governor of Bengal, one of the most disturbed provinces of India. View Full Article in Timesmachine Â»
